comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.4) Gecko/20070515 Firefox/2.0.0.4
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.8.1.4) Gecko/20070515 Firefox/2.0.0.4

Usually, when it happens, I have multiple Firefox windows (not tabs) open and am working with one of the many websites at Ancestry.com (such as:  http://content.ancestry.com/iexec/?htx=View&r=an&dbid=7667&iid=ILM653_187-0260&fn=Eliza&ln=Collins&st=d&ssrc=&pid=37459719)
When I restart Firefox, it generally restarts (correctly) all the windows that were open.
Can't pinpoint what specifically caused the crash - but generally I am browsing through an image provided by Ancestry.com

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Not sure what causes the crash/shut down
2.
3.
Actual Results:  
Can't make it happen on purpose.


I can provide a "rtf" file with images of the error messages and a copy of the file that was produced when the crash occurred.

The first error message states:  "Firefox.exe has encountered a problem and needs to close.  We are sorry for the inconvenience.....If you were in the middle of something, the information you were working on might be lost.......For more information about this error, click here........Close button"

When I click on the "more information" link, another error box appears which states:  Error signature......AppName:  firefox.exe..........AppVer.  1.8.2007051502.......ModName:  ntdll.dll...........ModVer: 5.1.2600.2180..............Offset:  000111de.............To view technical information about this error report, click here............Close button"

The file where the technical info is stored is called ...........73ef_appcompat.txt.   

I can send the contents of that file if you request.
comments.author: jadhunt.dan@earthlink.net

comments.text:
Please try to reproduce in Safe Mode (http://kb.mozillazine.org/Safe_Mode)

Also try to upgrade your flash to 9.0.47 and java to 1.6.0 update 2 and report if you still crashes so frequently
comments.author: mak@mozilla.com
comments.raw_text:
Please try to reproduce in Safe Mode (http://kb.mozillazine.org/Safe_Mode)

Also try to upgrade your flash to 9.0.47 and java to 1.6.0 update 2 and report if you still crashes so frequently
comments.creator: mak@mozilla.com

comments.text:
Possibly a duplicate of bug 366415

Dan: The Windows Crash reports are not very useful. What is useful is a Talkback report. Please make sure Talkback is installed, try to reproduce the crash, submit the talkback report and then report the ID here with a description of what you were doing at the time.

You may be experiencing different causes for the crashes you see. If you follow the steps to reproduce in bug 366415 then you are pretty much guaranteed to crash. A crash while browsing elsewhere is most likely a different bug. A talkback report is the easiest way to tell.
comments.author: wildmyron@gmail.com
